name: Swissotel Quito

reviews.text: Our 24-person tour group stayed here on three separate occasions during our trip to Ecuador, four nights total. The first two times we were in guest rooms, the last time in a suite. All were very clean and nicely decorated.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: The guest room had king-sized beds, desk, minibar, safe, coffee corner, iron and board and room for all our things. Robes and slippers were provided. The mattress in the second room we had was too hard to be very comfortable, and, had we been staying longer, we would have asked to change rooms. On the other two occasions, the beds were very comfortable.
reviews.title: What you would expect from Swissotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite we had on our final stay was wonderful! There was a living room with a small sofa, armchair and coffee table, a round dining table with four chairs, a full-length mirror, a large TV, CD player, wi-fi, a large desk with stationery supplies in one drawer and a printer. The bedroom had a king-size bed, two closets, a large flat-screen TV, radio and DVD player. There were three phones in the suite. All the amenities we had in our previous guest rooms were also present.
reviews.title: High quality modern hotel

reviews.text: There was a half-bath neat the entry and the main bathroom had double sinks, tub with shower, magnifying mirror, a large assortment of toiletries and a scale.
reviews.title: Questionable for Quality but Great Service

reviews.text: Our group was greeted each time we arrived with hot, damp towels and fresh exotic fruit juices. The group had special dietary requirements, and we were givien our own dining and meeting room and a chef, who was under the direction of an employee of the tour agency who sponsored the trip. The staff was exceptionally accommodating. I have nothing but praise for this hotel.
reviews.title: hospitable, excellent breakfasts, reliable, comfortable

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights before heading to the Galapagos. I arrived late after an evening flight and they actually greeted me by name as I arrived...as they were expecting me - I was the last reservation of the evening to show up. I got a kick out of that!!! haha. The room was a good size with a very comfy bed not to mention VERY clean - which is a huge factor for me when chosing a hotel. There is free wifi in the lobby only. I wish they had it in the rooms...it was available but at a charge. The turndown service with the rose and the chocolate was a nice touch. The staff was very friendly - opening doors, pushing the elevator buttons and helping anyway they could. I didn't use the pool as I was too busy touring around the historical centre which was about a 20 minute walk away. There is a supermarket up the street which was very handy for getting drinks and snacks. I would stay here again and recommend this hotel for sure.
reviews.title: Great hotel
What year is it anyway?
reviews.text: I just checked into this hotel and the warm towels and orange juice were great. However, I am here for work and I can not get wireless internet in my room. There is an internet cable, but I use an iPad and Macbook Air. Shouldn't a hotel of this stature be up to date on the technology needs of its clients?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it's a beautiful hotel - well maintained, nice, friendly staff, very nice comfortable rooms...but, i was a little hesitant to give it 4 stars because the 2 nights that i stayed there they forgot my wake up calls, and one morning they didn't remember my room service breakfast. the missed wake up calls would have been significant had we not had a back-up alarm clock in place. the fact that we don't speak fluent spanish and they are not fluent in english was likely the problem. that said, the rooms are beautiful and clean and very comfortable, and if that's all you need then you will be pleased.
reviews.title: mixed review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our recent visit to the Swissotel in downtown Quito was our second stay at this 5-star establishment and it lived up to its reputation as a gracious, luxury hotel. Although prices can be over the top, on both occasions we managed to arrange very reasonable rates through local agencies, so some "wheeling and dealing" is recommended in advance.
reviews.title: good service even at midnight!

reviews.text: We arrived about 11:30 pm, tired and hungry due to a flight delay. Restaurants were closed but the room service staff provided a relatively inexpensive midnight dinner complete with a bottle of wine, white linen service and a very cheerful server.
reviews.title: Hotel beautiful, service very poor

reviews.text: I find this Swissotel to be quite a mixed bag, with the pros and cons summarized below:

reviews.title: Excellent Option for New City-Quito

reviews.text: Large and well-equipped gym, pool, and spa area
reviews.title: Very nice hotel - would definitely return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly and attentive staff
reviews.title: Nice, nothing special

reviews.text: Excellent turn-down service
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: We traveled with our to babies (2 year old and 4month old) from the moment we arrived through the moment we took the free shuttle to the airport we received quality service. Traveling with kids that age we highly appreciate the readiness to open a door, help with our baggage. We even got reassign to a larger room in order to have more space with our babies. Great buffet to all tastes, pancakes for my kids and exotic fruits and ceviche for my husband and. The difference between Swissotel and a 5 star hotel: they only have WiFi in the lobby area, no flat screen and old (clean) carpets. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Good and friendly service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Swissotel has a remarkable range of services for a mid-sized hotel - from connected heated indoor + outdoor pools, gym, spa, squash court (!), computer room to 5 restaurants offering a wide range of cuisines. There are many classy touches, such as sumptous displays of roses.
reviews.title: Everything you could need in a hotel in Quito

reviews.text: The Café where breakfasts are also served is very pleasant, and its breakfast buffet has an amazing range of Ecuadorian tropical fruit and juices. Delicious. Based on our experience, the hotel is also well organized for conferences. The location is good for business and for tourism.
reviews.title: "room for improvement"

reviews.text: The staff during our stay were all pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: The only aspect I noted for improvement is some modernizing of the rooms (though they are well maintained). Our room had a traditional clunky TV and oversized cabinet to house it.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel - nothing special

description: Swissotel Quito is a luxury hotel conveniently located in the commercial and residential area of Quito. The hotel is within easy access to the Old Town and to the airport. Known as the kindest hotel of Latin America, Swissotel Quito is recognised for the finest service in the city. Six excellent restaurants offer a wide variety of international cuisine. From Mediterranean, Swiss, Japanese and sumptuous buffets, there is menu to suit every taste at Swissôtel Quito. The hotel’s Amrita Spa is the perfect place for relaxation or lively workout. Facilities include an indoor and outdoor swimming pool, sauna, steam bath, fitness centre, squash, and racquet and tennis courts. Swissotel Quito offers the largest and most modern convention centre in the city.
